strategies.name: Root Cause Loop
strategies.description: Keep asking "why" until you hit bedrock. Most fixes address symptoms, not causes.
strategies.example: Tests failing after auth change? Why? Session expired. Why? Token refresh broken. Why? Date parsing bug.

strategies.name: Progressive Disclosure
strategies.description: Expand incrementally. Start with one file, prove it works, then expand.
strategies.example: Refactoring a module? Start with the main entry point. Get it green. Then follow the imports.

strategies.name: Devil's Advocate
strategies.description: Force counter-arguments before committing. What could go wrong?
strategies.example: Before migrating the database schema, explicitly list three ways it could fail in production.

strategies.name: Parallel Spike
strategies.description: Try N approaches in parallel, compare results, pick the winner.
strategies.example: Performance optimization? Try caching, query optimization, and lazy loading in parallel.

strategies.name: Agent Council
strategies.description: Spawn distinct roles to review from different angles.
strategies.example: Security review: spawn CISO, developer, and attacker perspectives. Compare findings.

strategies.name: Timeboxed Exploration
strategies.description: Hard stop after N minutes, then decide with what you have.
strategies.example: Investigating a bug? Set 20-minute timer. At the bell, decide: fix what you found or escalate.

strategies.name: Checkpoint Recovery
strategies.description: Save state periodically. Resume safely after interruption.
strategies.example: Large refactor? Commit after each module. If context window expires, resume from last commit.

strategies.name: Dependency Unwinding
strategies.description: Atomic rollback when changes entangle unexpectedly.
strategies.example: Changed three files and broke five? Roll back to last checkpoint, attack one file at a time.

strategies.name: Consensus Building
strategies.description: Structured resolution when multiple agents disagree.
strategies.example: Two agents propose different architectures? Have each defend their choice, then vote on criteria.
